subject: Investing
title: Why Most Fund Managers Lose
description: Learn Why Most Fund Managers Lose in one minute.

hook.text: Every year, fund managers promise to beat the market. Every year, most fail. The data is brutal.

buildup.text: Markets are zero-sum before costs. After fees, the average active fund must underperform the index.

discovery.text: Sharpe proved it: all investors combined hold the market. After fees, most must trail the index.

twist.text: Survivorship bias hides the carnage. Funds that fail simply close. You only see winners still standing.

climax.text: A fund that beats the market for 5 years has only a 20% chance of repeating over the next 5.

punchline.text: Beating the market is possible. Doing it consistently is near-impossible.

quiz.question: Why must the average active fund underperform after costs?
options: All investors combined hold the market, so costs create a gap
